intro: Ornithopus compressus var. leiocarpus, commonly known as the slender rocket mustard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring. The plant is typically found in dry, disturbed soils and is often used in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
